summary: A foundational book on value investing, emphasizing margin of safety and disciplined long-term strategies.
keyInsights: Always invest with a margin of safety.
The market is a voting machine in the short term, but a weighing machine in the long run.
Investing is most intelligent when it is most businesslike.

summary: Insights from interviews with top traders reveal the importance of risk management and psychological control.
keyInsights: There’s no single strategy for success in trading.
Discipline and patience are essential for consistency.
Cut losses quickly and let winners run.

summary: Explores how personal behavior and mindset often matter more than financial knowledge.
keyInsights: Wealth is what you don’t see—savings matter more than spending.
Time is the most powerful force in investing.
Luck and risk are two sides of the same coin.
